alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 12:31AM EST until January 12 at 3:31AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Elbert County in northeast Georgia. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1228 AM EST, High water conditions continue along Beaverdam Creek due to runoff from the earlier heavy rainfall. Flooding is ongoing in the stream channel. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elberton, Bowman, Middleton, Lake Russell and Dewy Rose. - Flooding is most likely along the Beaverdam Creek at Brewers Mill Road above Elberton. Inundation of Horse Farm Road is likely. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
